name: B. Swaps
statement:
You are given two arrays a and b of length n. Array a contains each
integer from 1 to 2n in an arbitrary order, and array b contains each
integer from 1 to 2n in an arbitrary order.You can perform the following
operation on those arrays: choose one of the two arrays pick an index i
from 1 to n-1 swap the i-th and the (i+1)-th elements of the chosen
array Compute the minimum number of operations needed to make array a
lexicographically smaller than array b.For two different arrays x and y
of the same length n, we say that x is lexicographically smaller than y
if in the first position where x and y differ, the array x has a smaller
element than the corresponding element in y.
